==Events==
*[[1279 BC]] &ndash; [[Ramesses II]] (The Great) (19th dynasty) becomes pharaoh of [[Ancient Egypt]].
* [[455]] &ndash; Emperor [[Petronius Maximus]] is [[Stoning|stoned to death]] by an [[Ochlocracy|angry mob]] while fleeing [[Ancient Rome|Rome]].
* [[526]] &ndash; A devastating earthquake strikes [[Antioch]], [[Turkey]], killing 250,000.
*[[1223]] &ndash; Mongol invasion of the Cumans: [[Battle of the Kalka River]] &ndash; [[Mongol Empire|Mongol]] armies of [[Genghis Khan]] led by [[Subutai]] defeat [[Kievan Rus']] and [[Cuman people|Cumans]].
*[[1578]] &ndash; [[Martin Frobisher]] sails from [[Harwich]] in [[England]] to [[Frobisher Bay]] in [[Canada]], eventually to mine [[pyrite|fool's gold]], used to pave streets in [[London]].
*  1578   &ndash; King [[Henry III of France|Henry III]] lays the first stone of the [[Pont Neuf]] (''New Bridge''), the oldest bridge of [[Paris]], [[France]].
*[[1669]] &ndash; Citing poor eyesight, [[Samuel Pepys]] records the last event in his [[diary]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: The [[Mecklenburg Resolves]] are allegedly adopted in the [[Province of North Carolina]].
*[[1790]] &ndash; [[Manuel Quimper]] explores the [[Strait of Juan de Fuca]].
*  1790   &ndash; The [[United States]] enacts its first [[United States copyright law|copyright statute]], the [[Copyright Act of 1790]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: the [[Revolutionary Tribunal]] is suppressed.
*[[1805]] &ndash; French and Spanish forces begin the [[Battle of Diamond Rock|assault]] against British forces occupying [[Diamond Rock]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; In [[Australia]], [[William Lawson (explorer)|William Lawson]], [[Gregory Blaxland]] and [[William Wentworth]] reach [[Mount Blaxland, New South Wales|Mount Blaxland]], effectively marking the end of a route across the [[Blue Mountains (New South Wales)|Blue Mountains]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[civil death]] procedure is abolished in France.
*[[1859]] &ndash; The clock tower at the [[Palace of Westminster|Houses of Parliament]], which houses [[Big Ben]], starts keeping time.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]] [[Peninsula Campaign]]: [[Battle of Seven Pines]] or (Battle of Fair Oaks) &ndash; Confederate forces under [[Joseph E. Johnston]] & [[Gustavus Woodson Smith|G.W. Smith]] engage Union forces under [[George B. McClellan]] outside Richmond, Virginia.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]] [[Overland Campaign]]: [[Battle of Cold Harbor]] &ndash; The [[Army of Northern Virginia]] under [[Robert E. Lee]] engages the [[Army of the Potomac]] under [[Ulysses S. Grant]] and [[George Meade]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; In the [[Fenian raids|Fenian Invasion of Canada]], John O'Neill leads 850 [[Fenian]] raiders across the [[Niagara River]] at [[Buffalo, New York]]/[[Fort Erie, Ontario]], as part of an effort to free [[Ireland]] from the [[United Kingdom]]. [[Canada|Canadian]] [[militia]] and [[British Armed Forces|British]] regulars repulse the invaders in over the next three days, at a cost of 9 dead and 38 wounded to the [[Fenian]]'s 19 dead and about 17 wounded.
*[[1879]] &ndash; Gilmores Garden in [[New York City|New York, New York]], is renamed [[Madison Square Garden (1879)|Madison Square Garden]] by [[William Henry Vanderbilt]] and is opened to the public at 26th Street and [[Madison Avenue]].
*[[1884]] &ndash; The arrival at [[Plymouth]] of [[Tāwhiao]], King of [[Māori people|Maoris]], to claim the protection of [[Queen Victoria]]
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Johnstown Flood]]: Over 2,200 people die after a dam fails and sends a 60-foot (18-meter) wall of water over the town of [[Johnstown, Pennsylvania]].
*[[1902]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: The [[Treaty of Vereeniging]] ends the war and ensures [[United Kingdom|British]] control of [[South Africa]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; The [[National Negro Committee]], forerunner to the [[National Association for the Advancement of Colored People]], convenes for the first time.
*[[1910]] &ndash; The creation of the [[Union of South Africa]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; The hull of the ocean liner {{RMS|Titanic}} is launched.
*  1911   &ndash; The [[President of Mexico]] [[Porfirio Díaz]] flees the country during the [[Mexican Revolution]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of Jutland]] &ndash; The British [[Grand Fleet]] under the command of [[John Jellicoe, 1st Earl Jellicoe]] and [[David Beatty, 1st Earl Beatty]] engage the [[Imperial German Navy]] under the command of [[Reinhard Scheer]] and [[Franz von Hipper]] in the largest naval battle of the war, which proves indecisive.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Tulsa race riot]]: [[Civil disorder|civil unrest]] in [[Tulsa, Oklahoma]]. The official death toll is 39, but recent investigations suggest the actual toll may be much higher.
*[[1924]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] signs an agreement with the [[Beijing]] government, referring to [[Outer Mongolia]] as an "integral part of the Republic of [[China]]", whose "sovereignty" therein the [[Soviet Union]] promises to respect.
*[[1927]] &ndash; The last [[Ford Model T]] rolls off the [[assembly line]] after a production run of 15,007,003 vehicles.
*[[1929]] &ndash; The first talking [[Mickey Mouse]] cartoon, "[[The Karnival Kid]]", is released.
*[[1935]] &ndash; A 7.7 [[moment magnitude scale|Mw]] [[1935 Balochistan earthquake|earthquake]] destroys [[Quetta]] in modern-day [[Pakistan]] killing 40,000.
*[[1941]] &ndash; A [[Bombing of Dublin in World War II|Luftwaffe]] air raid on [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]], claims 38 lives.
*  1941   &ndash; [[Anglo-Iraqi War]]: The [[United Kingdom]] completes the re-occupation of [[Iraq]] and returns [['Abd al-Ilah]] to power as regent for [[Faisal II of Iraq|Faisal II]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[midget submarine]]s begin a series of [[attack on Sydney Harbour|attacks on Sydney]], [[Australia]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The [[Union of South Africa]] becomes the [[South Africa|Republic of South Africa]].
*  1961   &ndash; In [[Moscow]] City Court, the [[Rokotov–Faibishenko case|Rokotov–Faibishenko]] [[show trial]] begins, despite the [[Khrushchev Thaw]] to reverse [[Stalinism|Stalinist]] elements in Soviet society.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[West Indies Federation]] dissolves.
*  1962   &ndash; [[Adolf Eichmann]] is hanged in [[Israel]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[1970 Ancash earthquake|Ancash earthquake]] causes a [[landslide]] that buries the town of [[Yungay, Peru]]; more than 47,000 people are killed.
*[[1971]] &ndash; In accordance with the [[Uniform Monday Holiday Act]] passed by the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] in [[1968]], observation of [[Memorial Day]] occurs on the last Monday in [[May]] for the first time, rather than on the traditional [[Memorial Day]] of [[May 30]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] votes to cut off funding for the bombing of [[Khmer Rouge]] targets within [[Cambodia]], hastening the end of the [[Cambodian Civil War]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[Trans-Alaska Pipeline System]] completed.
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[burning of Jaffna library]] in [[Sri Lanka]]. It is one of the violent examples of ethnic [[Book burning|biblioclasm]] of the twentieth century.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[1985 United States–Canadian tornado outbreak]]: Forty-one tornadoes hit [[Ohio]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[New York]], and [[Ontario]], leaving 76 dead.
*[[1989]] &ndash; A group of six members of the guerrilla group [[Túpac Amaru Revolutionary Movement]] (MRTA) of Peru, shoot dead eight [[transsexualism|transsexuals]], in the city of [[Tarapoto]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Bicesse Accords]] in [[Angola]] lay out a transition to multi-party [[democracy]] under the supervision of the [[United Nations]]' [[United Nations Angola Verification Mission II|UNAVEM II]] mission.
*[[2005]] &ndash; ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' reveals that [[Mark Felt]] was [[Deep Throat (Watergate)|Deep Throat]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; In international waters, armed [[Shayetet 13]] commandos, intending to force the flotilla to anchor at the [[Ashdod]] port, [[gaza flotilla raid|boarded]] ships trying to break the [[Blockade of the Gaza Strip|ongoing blockade]] of the [[Gaza Strip]], resulting in nine civilian deaths.
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[asteroid]] [[(285263) 1998 QE2|1998 QE2]] and its [[Natural satellite|moon]] make their [[List of asteroid close approaches to Earth|closest approach to Earth]] for the next two centuries.
